title: IBM Cloud Logs
introduction: IBM Cloud Logs is a scalable logging service that persists logs and provides users with capabilities for querying, tailing, and visualizing logs.

section_recommended.title: Understanding IBM Cloud Logs
section_recommended.description: Learn about how to view, analyze, and alert on logging and activity tracking events.

section_recommended.title: Getting started with IBM Cloud Logs
section_recommended.description: Provision an instance of IBM Cloud Logs to investigate its functionality.

section_recommended.title: Migrating from IBM Log Analysis and IBM Cloud Activity Tracker
section_recommended.description: IBM Cloud Logs replaces the deprecated IBM Log Analysis and IBM Cloud Activity tracker services. Learn how to migrate from these service to IBM Cloud Logs using the provided migration tooling.

section_recommended.title: See what's new
section_recommended.description: Read about the latest changes to IBM Cloud Logs.

section_recommended.title: See what's new in the agent
section_recommended.description: Read about the changes to the Logging agent.
